summary: Warren Buffett's record of delivering market-beating returns for Berkshire Hathaway shareholders over six decades will be very difficult for any CEO to match . Berkshire owns a large portfolio of quality stocks that can help you grow your savings . Splitting your money between the following stocks would lay a promising foundation for long-term growth .  Buffett brought in Todd Combs and Ted Weschler several years ago to oversee a small portion of Berkshire's investments . One of their top picks is none other than e-commerce and cloud services leader Amazon . The stock has more than doubled since Berkshire first boughtshares of Amazon in 2019's first quarter .  Amazon earned $66 billion in net income on $650 billion of revenue in the past year . Analysts expect Amazon's earnings to grow at an annualized rate of 19% in the coming years . Buffett has pledged not to sell a single share of his Berkshire Hathaway stock .  Abel took over as CEO of MidAmerican in 2008, which Berkshire acquired in 1999 . Abel will be charged with overseeing a large portfolio of operating businesses, spanning retail, the BNSF railroad, manufacturing, and insurance businesses .  Abel will continue in the same role as Buffett, primarily focused on allocating capital to new opportunities . Abel may take a more active approach than Buffett in encouraging some of Berkshire's businesses to enter new markets or make a bolt-on acquisition that increases their value .  This is the best time to buy before it’s too late . Nvidia, Apple and Netflix are among the companies you can invest in . You can invest $1,000 in each of these stocks when you join Stock Fool's "Double Down" alerts .

The company is in the right place at the right time, but its current rate of growth may not be sustainable . The banking business is increasingly moving online .  Nubank now serves 118.6 million people, versus fewer than 10 million just six years ago . As the 2025 first quarter, 90% of its deposits were in Brazil . The remainder come from Colombia and Mexico .  A record 137 million smartphones were shipped to Latin America in 2024, according to Canalys . Of those devices, 88% are likely to be web-connected smartphones . Half of these expected mobile subscribers will likely live in Brazil and Mexico, where Nubank operates .  Research firm Imarc expects Brazil's neobanking (digital-only banking) industry to grow at an annualized pace of nearly 45% through 2033 . Nubank helped nearly 21 million Brazilians get their very first credit card in five years .  Nu Nu is a fantastic stock with a ton of long-term upside potential . The stock has done it several times in the past . Amazon is still around 15% below its previous high . The company's valuation is as attractive as Amazon's, and there are five reasons why the stock could deliver such a lofty return .  Amazon Web Services (AWS) should have tremendous growth prospects over the next few years . CEO Andy Jassy noted in the company's October 2024 quarterly call that Amazon only has around a 1% market share of the global retail market . I don't foresee thegenerative AItailwind waning anytime soon .  A prolonged global economic decline would make it much more difficult for Amazon to generate a 100% return by 2030 . The Trump administration's relaxation of trade tensions with China could reduce the likelihood of a recession . Amazon will keep churning out incremental growth by expanding into new markets . I think it's more likely that generative AI will pay off handsomely .  Amazon has what it takes to jump 100% by 2030, it's Amazon.com's Jeff Bezos . The "Magnificent Seven" refers to a group of seven American technology giants that are the dominant players in their markets . Amazon's dominant presence in two massive markets that are benefiting from the adoption of AI is going to be a long-term catalyst for the company . The e-commerce and cloud computing giant's earnings growth is expected to accelerate .  E-commerce and cloud computing giant Amazon has delivered impressive returns of 145% since the beginning of 2023 . Amazon has the potential to continue outperforming the broader market in the long run thanks to its focus on integrating AI tools and services into its businesses .  The company generated $94 billion in revenue in the first quarter from its online stores and third-party seller services . Amazon has been integrating AI-focused tools to ensure that it can corner a nice chunk of this phenomenal opportunity . The adoption of AI in the e-commerce market is expected to grow at an annual rate of 24% through 2033 .  Project Amelia is a generative AI assistant that allows sellers to gain insights into their business with simple prompts . Amazon Web Services (AWS) delivered $29 billion in revenue for Amazon in Q1, which was nearly double the increase in its overall revenue .  The booming demand for cloud-based AI services could open up a potential revenue opportunity of nearly $650 billion for Amazon by 2030 . Amazon's customers can build and deploy AI applications in the cloud with the help of popular large language models powered by powerful graphics cards .  Amazon plans to raise its capex in 2025 to $100 billion, which would be a 20% increase over last year . Analysts are forecasting a 12% increase in its bottom line this year to $6.20 per share, but that's expected to be followed by stronger years in 2026 and 2027 . The massive end-market opportunities in the e-commerce and cloud computing markets could help Amazon deliver strong levels of earnings growth . Two new locations entered Oxford Economics' global ranking of cities this year . The economic advisory firm's Global Cities Index scored the 1,000 largest cities across five categories: economics, human capital, quality of life, environment and governance . The significance of cities in this period of uncertainty can't be overstated .  French capital of Paris took over in third place this year from US city of San Jose, which fell to fourth spot . San Jose is renowned for the tech hub of Silicon Valley, which is home to big-name companies, including Apple and Google .  The US city of Seattle, which rounded out the top five, also boasts a major sector – with Microsoft (MSFT) and Amazon (AMZN) operating in the area . The Australian cities of Melbourne and Sydney came in sixth and seventh place .  Several cities in India, Indonesia, and the UK have risen in the rankings this year, while Japanese, Canadian, and Brazilian cities mostly fell . Tokyo, Japan in ninth place and San Francisco in tenth spot .  Global Leaders are best positioned to maximise the benefits of generative AI but must address rising inequality . Developing Megacities have the potential for significant human capital growth but must overcome rapid urbanisation challenges .

Nike announced plans to return to Amazon and toraise prices across key categories . Adult apparel and equipment would see price hikes of $2 to $10 . Nike sources much of its footwear from China and Vietnam . Iconic silhouettes such as the Air Force 1 were exempted .  Nike will once again sell direct to Amazon after a 6-year hiatus . The sportswear giant plans to reinstate its official storefront on Amazon . The move is designed to regain market share ceded to younger competitors .  Nike will re-enter Amazon, clearing the channel for Nike’s own listings . Nike first experimented with a direct Amazon storefront in 2017, aiming to clamp down on unauthorized resellers and enforce its minimum advertised price policies . Decision comes as peers recalibrate their own distribution amid rising U.S. import levies .  Nike has a renewed, tightly controlled presence on Amazon’s platform, reflecting a dual mandate to safeguard its premium positioning . Industry observers will watch closely to see whether the move toward Amazon under Hill can recapture lost sales .

Nike is planning to raise prices of some products from next week . The footwear retailer will increase prices on apparel and equipment for adults between $2 and $10 . The company sources a significant portion of its footwear from China and Vietnam .  Nike stopped selling on Amazon in 2019 as it shifted focus to sales on its own websites and in stores . North America was Nike's biggest market by revenue, as of 2024 . Amazon notified some of those merchants that it will ban them from selling certain Nike products from July 19 .  Amazon says it will sell through its inventory of overlapping items . Amazon will continue to sell through their inventory of overlap items, a spokesperson said . Amazon says the move will allow it to compete with other retailers .

Wall Street's enthusiasm for Target Corp. is at its lowest in more than six years . Analysts at Bank of America, Melius Research LLC and Telsey Advisory Group all stepped back from their buy-equivalent calls since the company’s earnings report on Wednesday .  Target's shares closed up 2.2% on Thursday after an earnings-related drop in the previous session . The stock has fallen about 30% this year through Thursday’s close, shaving nearly $18.8 billion from its market capitalization . The company cut its annual sales forecast on Wednesday after a sharp pullback in consumer spending .  Telsey Advisory Group analyst Joseph Feldman downgrades Target to market perform . Melius’ Jacob Aiken-Phillips also downgrades the company to hold, citing the company’s elevated exposure to tariffs .  Target now has 12 buy-equivalent recommendations, 26 holds and two sells . Target’s core categories offer “wider assortments, sharper prices, and enhanced convenience” But in the longer term, growth in high-margin businesses may support greater margin stability .

Amazon is trialling a new feature that uses generative AI to create short-form audio summaries on select product detail pages . The feature provides concise overviews of products by analysing product details, customer reviews, and other relevant online information . The initial test feature targets products that often require careful consideration before buying, offering clear insights through in-depth discussion to help Amazon customers shop more efficiently .  Amazon has been increasing its use of AI across its operations . The move aligns with broader industry trends, as tech companies rapidly deploy AI technologies . Amazon and Grubhub are entering the second year of a five-year commercial agreement that gives Amazon Prime members access to the food delivery platform’s subscription program at no extra cost . As part of the deal, the ordering tab was integrated directly into the Amazon app and website, allowing users to order burritos while shopping for face wash or streaming a show .  Amazon plans to add food delivery through itsAlexa+ service this year . The collaboration arrives at a time when many companies are enhancing their subscription offerings . Amazon is competing with loyalty programs from Walmart and Target .  Grubhub+ membership gives users $0 delivery fees and lower service fees . Amazon Prime members who use the service “save an average of $300 per year” Amazon declined to share specific numbers on signups . Uber Eats and DoorDash also have loyalty programs bolstered by third-party deals .  Amazon has a huge reach and Grubhub has been able to tap into this, Saunders says . The partnership expands the audience and the number or orders it fulfills, he says .

PillPack founders TJ Parker and Elliot Cohen are building an online storefront for medical care that they believe can become the one-stop shop that doesn't currently exist . Today, the startup and online shop, called General Medicine, is launching publicly, backed by Amazon .  General Medicine is part-telehealth provider, part-medical concierge, and part-marketplace for browsing and booking medical care . New patients upload their insurance information if they have it and take a short survey about the issue they are experiencing, which creates a customized intake form .  General Medicine's own doctors are in-network with many large providers including United Healthcare, Blue Cross and United Healthcare . Patients can message or conduct a video chat with General Medicine’s in-house doctors . Pricing is transparent for cash-paying or insurance-covered patients .  General Medicine makes money like a regular doctor’s office might if a customer conducts a telehealth visit with telehealth . The goal is to truly become the starting point for just about all medical needs outside of emergencies .  General Medicine will also monetize some of its other services with small fees . The company could also potentially partner with big consumer AI companies to help customers book or find medical care after they research information through a chatbot .  General Medicine’s approach does have some similarities to Amazon One Medical Pay-per-visit, formerly called Amazon Care, which is also an online marketplace for medical care services . But as of now, “Ours is a far more fulsome experience.”

Artificial intelligence (AI) has become a core focus for Amazon's e-commerce and cloud infrastructure businesses in particular . In less than two years, Amazon's valuation has soared by nearly $1 trillion . Amazon's long-term growth prospects look strong and a $5 trillion valuation by 2030 looks achievable .  Amazon has been investing aggressively in several different areas of AI . Anthropic is now an integral part of Amazon's cloud infrastructure business, Amazon Web Services . Amazon has also been designing its own custom silicon chips -- dubbed Trainium and Inferentia .  Amazon and Anthropic initially announced their partnership on Sept. 25, 2023 . Since that announcement, Amazon has added nearly $1 trillion in market capitalization . CEO Andy Jassy told investors that the company's "AI business right now is a multibillion-dollar annual run rate business"  Analysts expect Amazon to maintain 10% annual revenue growth between now and 2027 . Amazon's price-to-sales (P/S) ratio is 3.4 -- much lower than many of its "Magnificent Seven" peers . In order to reach a $5 trillion valuation, Amazon's P/S ratio would need to expand to roughly 4.5 .  Over the next five years, Amazon's AI-inspired investments will start to become more obvious . Amazon could be in a position to witness either an increase in revenue above 10% annual growth, or an expansion in its multiples . To me, Amazon has multiple avenues to achieve a $5 trillion valuation by 2030 .  Stock Advisor’s total average return is962% — a market-crushing outperformance compared to169% for the S&P 500 . Apple Inc. has become a frequent target for attacks by President Donald Trump . The iPhone maker was the biggest company in the world at the start of May, but since then, it’s fallen to third . It underperformed again Wednesday, falling in a broadly negative session .  Apple shares fell 0.5% on Thursday, on track for their seventh straight negative session . Trump said he “had a little problem with Tim Cook,” and asked Apple’s chief executive officer to stop building plants in India . Political risk has been a driver of markets overall this year .  Apple's fate has been closely tied to the trade war and it has avoided the worst-case scenario that seemed plausible last month . While shares saw incredible tariff-related volatility, the stock is still up 16% from the low it hit after the tariffs were first announced in early April .  Resolving Trump's concerns around Apple’s foreign manufacturing may be tricky, given the near-impossibility of building iPhones and other hardware in the US, especially in the short term . But the ire targeted at Apple is only one of the geopolitical risks that the company is facing from Trump's policies . Financial results released earlier this month reinforced concerns about a slowdown in the China market .  Apple trades at 26.6 times estimated earnings, well above its 10-year average of 21.6 . It is also “the most under-owned mega cap tech stock” according to Morgan Stanley . Morgan Stanley examined its average weight in the top 100 actively managed institutional portfolios .  Baidu Inc.’s shares are reflecting concerns about intensifying competition in AI and a persistent economic downturn . Online marketing, meanwhile, remains vulnerable to a slowdown in domestic consumption . OpenAI will acquire the AI device startup co-founded by Apple veteran Jony Ive in a nearly $6.5 billion deal .
